ai.summary: Carn Brea BR 23 is a compact, easy 0.4 km hike in the UK. Designed for families and beginners, the route offers a gentle ascent to a viewpoint with countryside views, then returns along the same path. It’s a quick option for a short outdoor outing.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined grassy paths with a light incline. Occasional dirt sections and a few small rocky steps near the summit. Surface can be muddy in wet weather and may be uneven in places.
ai.safety_notes: Weather in the UK can change quickly. Wear sturdy, grippy footwear and stay on the marked path. Bring water, a basic map or GPS, and a charged phone. Check the forecast, start with daylight, and avoid the route in icy conditions. Be mindful of others on narrow sections and give way as needed.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking shoes or lightweight hiking boots
Layered clothing and a weather-appropriate outer layer
Sun protection (hat, sunscreen) in sunny weather
Map, GPS, or a charged phone with offline maps
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with spring and autumn offering the most comfortable conditions; summer provides longer daylight, while winter may bring wind and mud requiring extra care.

seo.title: Carn Brea BR 23: Easy 0.4 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Carn Brea BR 23, a short 0.4 km easy hike in the UK. Ideal for families and beginners, with grassy paths, a gentle ascent, and countryside views. Includes safety tips and gear.
seo.h1: Carn Brea BR 23 – Easy 0.4 km Hike in the UK
